title: Probably a very simple question, but you never know...
content:
I'm using fontographer on a pc and am trying to save a mac-truetype version of a font that I've made... my friend, who runs osx, says that he can't get it to work. The file extension is .Suit$. You can download it here: [http://www.craigbutterworth.com/type/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020235512/http:/www.craigbutterworth.com/type/index.html)   
Anyway, I'd appreciate any help that you can give.   
\_Craig
author: butterworth

comments.content:
With the really complicated ways to install a font on osX, perhaps your friend did some mistake...   
Otherwise, osX can use pc truetypes.   
   
Greg

True, Greg. OSX can be troublesome.   
But the fonts was generated incorrectly.   
I've sent Craig a Mac TT and PS file I converted.
Perhaps we can publish on typophile a tutorial of installing fonts on different systems, it can be useful.
